model

Class AbstractVehicle

  • java.lang.Object
    • model.AbstractVehicle
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Vehicle
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Bicycle, Car, Human, Truck

    public abstract class AbstractVehicle
extends java.lang.Object
implements Vehicle
    Represents an abstract vehicle.
    Version:
    15 October 2014
    Author:
    Jonathan Hughes

      • myDeathTime

        private final int myDeathTime
        The amount of time that this vehicle stays dead after it is killed. NOTE: The larger the death time, the easier it is for this vehicle to be killed. Any vehicle with a lesser death time will kill it upon collision.

      • myIsAlive

        Constructs an abstract vehicle.
        Parameters:
        theX - the starting x-coordinate for this vehicle
        theY - the starting y-coordinate for this vehicle
        theDir - the starting direction for this vehicle
        theDeathTime - the amount of time that this vehicle stays dead after it is killed

      • collide

        public void collide(Vehicle theOther)
        Models a collision of two live vehicles. When a collision occurs, if there is a vehicle with a longer death time, it dies and its turns until alive is set to the death time. If a vehicle killed another vehicle, it goes on a rampage.
        Specified by:
        collide in interface Vehicle
        Parameters:
        theOther - the other vehicle that is colliding with this vehicle The other object.

      • poke

        public void poke()
        The vehicle's counter for turns until revived is reduced by one, if this vehicle is not alive. If the counter reaches zero, the vehicle's state is change from dead to alive and it starts in a random direction. Called by the UI to notify a dead vehicle that 1 movement round has passed, so that it will become 1 move closer to revival.
        Specified by:
        poke in interface Vehicle

      • reset

        public void reset()
        Changes this vehicle to its starting conditions. Moves this vehicle back to its original position.
        Specified by:
        reset in interface Vehicle

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Returns a String of the vehicle type when alive, if dead returns "Pokes:" and turns until alive. If on a rampage, displays "Rampaging" in front of the type.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        a String of the vehicle type when alive, if dead returns "Pokes:" and turns until alive.
